logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: Materials to take us beyond concrete

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Concrete is everywhere, but it’s bad for the planet, generating large amounts of carbon dioxide – alternatives are being developed

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Harmful to the Earth's environment.

phase3Production.content: The excessive use of single-use plastics is undeniably bad for the planet.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: generating large amounts of carbon dioxide
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...generating large amounts of carbon dioxide – alternatives are being developed

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Tạo ra lượng lớn khí carbon dioxide

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Producing a significant quantity of the gas CO2, a primary greenhouse gas.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tạo ra lượng lớn khí carbon dioxide

phase3Production.content: Burning fossil fuels is a primary human activity generating large amounts of carbon dioxide.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Concrete is the second most used substance in the global economy, after water...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chất được sử dụng nhiều thứ hai

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The material that is utilized more than any other, with the exception of one.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chất được sử dụng nhiều thứ hai

phase3Production.content: After petroleum, coal is the second most used substance for energy production globally.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: biggest single sources of greenhouse gas emissions
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and one of the world’s biggest single sources of greenhouse gas emissions.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nguồn phát thải khí nhà kính đơn lẻ lớn nhất

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /ˈbɪɡɪst ˈsɪŋɡl ˈsɔːsɪz əv ˈɡriːnhaʊs ɡæs ɪˈmɪʃənz/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: One of the largest individual contributors to the release of gases that trap heat in the atmosphere.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nguồn phát thải khí nhà kính đơn lẻ lớn nhất

phase3Production.content: The energy sector remains one of the biggest single sources of greenhouse gas emissions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The chemical process by which cement, the key ingredient of concrete, is created results in large quantities of carbon dioxide.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The most important component of something.

phase3Production.content: Flour is the key ingredient in most types of bread.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The UN estimates that there will be 9.8 billion people living on the planet by mid-century.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: By the middle of the current century (around the year 2050).

phase3Production.content: Many scientists predict that climate change will have even more severe effects by mid-century.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: If concrete is the only answer to the construction of new cities, then carbon emissions will soar, aggravating global warming.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Lượng khí thải carbon sẽ tăng vọt

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The amount of carbon dioxide released into the atmosphere will increase rapidly to a high level.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lượng khí thải carbon sẽ tăng vọt

phase3Production.content: Without a shift to renewable energy, global carbon emissions will soar.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...then carbon emissions will soar, aggravating global warming.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Làm trầm trọng thêm tình trạng nóng lên toàn cầu

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Making the gradual increase in the overall temperature of the earth's atmosphere worse.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm trầm trọng thêm tình trạng nóng lên toàn cầu

phase3Production.content: Deforestation is a major factor in aggravating global warming.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: And so scientists have started innovating with other materials, in a scramble for alternatives to a universal commodity...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trong một cuộc tranh giành các giải pháp thay thế

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In a hurried and competitive effort to find other options.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong một cuộc tranh giành các giải pháp thay thế

phase3Production.content: After the main supplier went bankrupt, companies were in a scramble for alternatives.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...alternatives to a universal commodity that has underpinned our modern life for many years.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A raw material or primary agricultural product that is used and traded everywhere in the world.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một mặt hàng phổ biến toàn cầu

phase3Production.content: Oil has been a universal commodity that powers much of the global economy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a universal commodity that has underpinned our modern life for many years.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Làm nền tảng cho cuộc sống hiện đại của chúng ta

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have provided the basis or foundation for our contemporary way of living.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm nền tảng cho cuộc sống hiện đại của chúng ta

phase3Production.content: The development of the internet has underpinned our modern life in countless ways.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But it is the scale on which it is used that makes it high carbon. The sheer scale of manufacture is so huge, that is the issue.’

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The extremely large size or extent of the production process.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Not only are the ingredients of concrete relatively cheap and found in abundance in most places around the globe...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be available in large quantities; plentiful.

phase3Production.content: Limestone, a key ingredient in cement, is a rock that is found in abundance all over the world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the stuff itself has marvellous properties: Portland cement, the vital component of concrete, is mouldable and pourable, but quickly sets hard.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Wonderful or extraordinary characteristics or qualities.

phase3Production.content: Spider silk has marvellous properties, being both incredibly strong and lightweight.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Portland cement, the vital component of concrete, is mouldable and pourable...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An absolutely necessary or essential part of something.

phase3Production.content: Water is a vital component of all living organisms.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...is mouldable and pourable, but quickly sets hard.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có thể đúc và đổ khuôn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Able to be shaped into a particular form and able to be made to flow in a stream.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có thể đúc và đổ khuôn

phase3Production.content: When wet, clay is both mouldable and pourable, allowing artists to create complex shapes.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...is mouldable and pourable, but quickly sets hard.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To become solid and firm.

phase3Production.content: You must work quickly with the glue because it sets hard in just a few minutes.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Cheeseman also notes another advantage: concrete and steel have similar thermal expansion properties, so steel can be used to reinforce concrete...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đặc tính giãn nở vì nhiệt

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The characteristics of a material that describe how its size changes with a change in temperature.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đặc tính giãn nở vì nhiệt

phase3Production.content: Engineers must consider the thermal expansion properties of materials when building bridges.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...so steel can be used to reinforce concrete, making it far stronger and more flexible as a building material than it could be on its own.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To strengthen concrete by embedding steel bars or mesh within it.

phase3Production.content: Steel rebar is commonly used to reinforce concrete in large structures.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: According to Cheeseman, all these factors together make concrete hard to beat.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Difficult to surpass or be better than.

phase3Production.content: For its price and durability, this brand of car is hard to beat.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Making buildings from wood may seem like a rather medieval idea, but climate change is driving architects to turn to treated timber as a possible resource.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một ý tưởng khá là trung cổ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idea that seems old-fashioned or belonging to the Middle Ages.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một ý tưởng khá là trung cổ

phase3Production.content: His belief in chivalry seemed like a rather medieval idea in the modern world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...but climate change is driving architects to turn to treated timber as a possible resource.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thúc đẩy các kiến trúc sư

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be strongly motivating architects to do something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thúc đẩy các kiến trúc sư

phase3Production.content: Rising energy costs are driving architects to design more efficient buildings.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Recent years have seen the emergence of tall buildings constructed almost entirely from timber.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of coming into view or becoming prominent.

phase3Production.content: The last decade has seen the emergence of social media as a dominant force in communication.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Using wood to construct buildings, however, is not straightforward.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Not easy to do or understand; complicated.

phase3Production.content: Assembling the furniture was not straightforward and required two people.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Wood expands as it absorbs moisture from the air and is susceptible to pests, not to mention fire.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To take in water or other liquid from the surrounding environment.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and is susceptible to pests, not to mention fire.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Likely or liable to be influenced or harmed by harmful insects or other animals.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Cross-laminated timber is engineered wood.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A wood panel product made from gluing together layers of solid-sawn lumber, where each layer is oriented perpendicular to the next.

phase3Production.content: Cross-laminated timber is becoming a popular, sustainable alternative to concrete in construction.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A substance used for sticking objects or materials together; glue.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the key thing to consider is the extent to which concrete is used around the world...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The degree or level to which something happens or is true.

phase3Production.content: It is difficult to measure the extent to which the new policy has affected the economy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The sheer scale of manufacture is so huge, that is the issue.’

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A phrase used to emphasize the main point or the core of a problem.

phase3Production.content: It's not that he can't do the work, it's that he won't. That is the issue.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...found in abundance in most places around the globe...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Throughout the world.

phase3Production.content: The company has offices in major cities around the globe.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...making it far stronger and more flexible as a building material...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Much more strong; significantly more powerful or durable.

phase3Production.content: Alloyed with carbon, iron becomes steel, which is far stronger than pure iron.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...climate change is driving architects to turn to treated timber as a possible resource.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To start to use or do something new; to look to something for a solution.

phase3Production.content: When the power went out, we had to turn to candles for light.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Recent years have seen the emergence of tall buildings constructed almost entirely from timber.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được xây dựng gần như hoàn toàn từ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Built using a particular material for nearly all parts of the structure.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được xây dựng gần như hoàn toàn từ

phase3Production.content: The emergency shelter was constructed almost entirely from recycled materials.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and is susceptible to pests, not to mention fire.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Used to introduce an additional point which reinforces the point being made.

phase3Production.content: The hike was long and difficult, not to mention the fact that it was raining.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This material is light but has the strength of concrete and steel.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be as strong or durable as something else.

phase3Production.content: Carbon fiber is a modern material that has the strength of steel but is much lighter.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the company is seeing increasing demand globally for building in wood...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A growing desire among consumers to buy particular goods or services.

phase3Production.content: There is an increasing demand for electric vehicles as people become more environmentally conscious.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with climate change concerns the key driver.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những lo ngại về biến đổi khí hậu

phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những lo ngại về biến đổi khí hậu

phase3Production.content: Climate change concerns have led to greater investment in renewable energy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...will it be possible to see wood as a real alternative to concrete in constructing tall buildings.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự thay thế thực sự cho

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A genuinely viable or practical substitute for something else.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự thay thế thực sự cho

phase3Production.content: For many commuters, high-speed rail is now a real alternative to flying.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Fly ash... can be incorporated into concrete mixes...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be included as part of a whole.

phase3Production.content: Feedback from the survey will be incorporated into the final report.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to make up as much as 15 to 30% of the cement...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To constitute or form a particular amount or proportion of something.

phase3Production.content: International students make up as much as 40% of the university's population.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Their incorporation into concrete mixes has the potential to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The possibility of making something smaller or less in amount, degree, or size.

phase3Production.content: This new technology has the potential to reduce energy consumption by half.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...although these waste products can save carbon in the concrete mix, their use is not always straightforward.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To reduce the amount of carbon dioxide that is produced or released.

phase3Production.content: Using public transport instead of driving is a simple way to save carbon.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But there are several calculations that need to be considered across the entire life cycle of the building...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Must be taken into account or thought about carefully.

phase3Production.content: There are many factors that need to be considered before making such an important decision.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: If they are transported over long distances, using fossil fuels, the use of alternative materials might not make sense...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be moved from one place to another across a great area.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được vận chuyển qua những quãng đường dài

phase3Production.content: Fresh produce that is transported over long distances often loses some of its nutritional value.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...they are either unproven or based on materials that are not abundant.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Not existing or available in large quantities; not plentiful.

phase3Production.content: Helium is a resource that is not abundant on Earth, making it very valuable.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that has underpinned our modern life for many years.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: For a long period of time.

phase3Production.content: She has been a dedicated teacher at this school for many years.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The sheer scale of manufacture is so huge, that is the issue.’

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Extremely large in size or amount.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: According to Cheeseman, all these factors together make concrete hard to beat.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Recent years have seen the emergence of tall buildings constructed almost entirely from timber.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The period of the last few years.

phase3Production.content: In recent years, there has been a growing interest in sustainable living.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Finland... has been leading the way...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have been continuously at the forefront of a particular field or activity.
